response:
Subacute hemisensory–hemimotor deficit without brainstem or cortical signs most strongly suggests a lacunar sensorimotor stroke; alternatives include haemorrhage at the same site, demyelination in a young adult, embolic infarct from cervical artery dissection/cardioembolism, or a focal mass lesion.

differential_diagnosis = ["Lacunar infarct (thalamocapsular region)", "Intracerebral haemorrhage (thalamic/capsular)", "Multiple sclerosis relapse (deep white matter/thalamocapsular plaque)", "Cervical artery dissection with embolic ischaemic stroke", "Primary brain tumour or metastasis in thalamocapsular region"]
